intro: Ferulago pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered ferulago, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Ferulago pauciflora is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
